intro: Procris mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao procris, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in lowland forests and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
